title: Track encoding valiation throws error for additional metadata
description: The additional track metadata only made it into track.create.json and not track.json. An exception is thrown and logged on encoding, still the properties are included in the output. add the properties to track.json.

combined_text: Track encoding valiation throws error for additional metadata The additional track metadata only made it into track.create.json and not track.json. An exception is thrown and logged on encoding, still the properties are included in the output. add the properties to track.json.

title: NullPointerException when trying to export shapefile
description: The URL https://envirocar.org/api/dev/tracks/527a897ee4b08cecc59420d6.shp (shapefile export of track 527a897ee4b08cecc59420d6) returns an exception text containing a NullPointerException. I suspect this is caused by the first feature having less phenomenons than the following.

combined_text: Deleting Users Is it possible that your method to delete users doesn't work anymore? I don't get a server response while performing a delete request anymore (the same method works for deleting friends, though)

title: Incorrect removal of friends
description: Remove friend has a invalid rest endpoint at `DELETE /rest/users/:user/friends` with a entity reference to the removed friend. `DELETE /rest/users/:user/friends/:friend` would be the right choice. Currently `DELETE /rest/users/:user/friends/:friend` would entirely delete the user `friend`. Solution would be to create a new `FriendResource` that extends `UserResource` and overrides the `DELETE` operation. Also there currently isn't any check whether the current user is authorized to do so. Context: - [FriendsResource](https://github.com/car-io/car.io-server/blob/master/rest/src/main/java/io/car/server/rest/resources/FriendsResource.java#L75)

combined_text: Incorrect removal of friends Remove friend has a invalid rest endpoint at `DELETE /rest/users/:user/friends` with a entity reference to the removed friend. `DELETE /rest/users/:user/friends/:friend` would be the right choice. Currently `DELETE /rest/users/:user/friends/:friend` would entirely delete the user `friend`. Solution would be to create a new `FriendResource` that extends `UserResource` and overrides the `DELETE` operation. Also there currently isn't any check whether the current user is authorized to do so. Context: - [FriendsResource](https://github.com/car-io/car.io-server/blob/master/rest/src/main/java/io/car/server/rest/resources/FriendsResource.java#L75)

title: Schema resource redirect loop
description: Every schema of the [schema resource](https://envirocar.org/api/stable/schema) will lead to a redirect loop due to the [content negotiation filter](https://github.com/enviroCar/enviroCar-server/blob/master/rest/src/main/java/org/envirocar/server/rest/URIContentNegotiationFilter.java). The `.json` part is stripped of by the filter and the [resource](https://github.com/enviroCar/enviroCar-server/blob/master/rest/src/main/java/org/envirocar/server/rest/resources/JSONSchemaResource.java#L85) will return a redirect if it is not present. Letting the [resource](https://github.com/enviroCar/enviroCar-server/blob/master/rest/src/main/java/org/envirocar/server/rest/resources/JSONSchemaResource.java#L85) just append `.json` at the end of the schema and look it up should solve the problem
patched_file_types: source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | config-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | config-file | config-file | test-file | test-file
text_for_topic_modeling: schema resource redirect loop every schema schema resource https envirocar api stable schema lead redirect loop due content negotiation filter https github envirocar envirocar server blob rest envirocar server rest uricontentnegotiationfilter json part stripped filter resource https github envirocar envirocar server blob rest envirocar server rest resources jsonschemaresource return redirect present letting resource https github envirocar envirocar server blob rest envirocar server rest resources jsonschemaresource append json end schema look solve
combined_text: Schema resource redirect loop Every schema of the [schema resource](https://envirocar.org/api/stable/schema) will lead to a redirect loop due to the [content negotiation filter](https://github.com/enviroCar/enviroCar-server/blob/master/rest/src/main/java/org/envirocar/server/rest/URIContentNegotiationFilter.java). The `.json` part is stripped of by the filter and the [resource](https://github.com/enviroCar/enviroCar-server/blob/master/rest/src/main/java/org/envirocar/server/rest/resources/JSONSchemaResource.java#L85) will return a redirect if it is not present. Letting the [resource](https://github.com/enviroCar/enviroCar-server/blob/master/rest/src/main/java/org/envirocar/server/rest/resources/JSONSchemaResource.java#L85) just append `.json` at the end of the schema and look it up should solve the problem
